about.title: About
about.subtitle: Learn about Aminul Haque
about.positionValue: Parliament Member Candidate (Dhaka-16), Convener, Dhaka North BNP
about.heightValue: Nationalism, Democracy, Good Governance, People's Rights & Development
about.biographyText1: Aminul Haque (born October 5, 1980) is a former Bangladeshi professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper. He is considered one of Bangladesh's best footballers and has been identified as "the greatest goalkeeper to represent Bangladesh."
about.biographyText2: According to former Bangladesh national team coach Georgi Kotan, Aminul is one of the best goalkeepers he has seen. Aminul's positional sense and understanding of the game has made him one of the best goalkeepers in South Asian football history.
about.biographyText3: ESPN Star's Shebby Singh suggested that Aminul could play in better leagues in England with proper training. Aminul is a player of MSPCC City Club and started his career in the Dhaka Premier Division League with Mohammedan SC in 1994.
about.internationalCareerDesc: Represented Bangladesh national team from 1998 to 2010
about.internationalCareerText1: Aminul represented the Bangladesh national team from 1998 to 2010. He earned approximately 56 caps, during which he captained his country in 2006, 2008, 2009, and 2010.
about.internationalCareerText2: 2003 SAFF Championship: During the penalty shootout, he saved a crucial shot from Ashraf Luthfi, which allowed Bangladesh to win their first SAFF Championship. Aminul was also named the tournament's best goalkeeper.
about.internationalCareerText3: 2010 South Asian Games: He led the Bangladesh U-23 team to win the gold medal.
about.internationalCareerText4: His performances at the international level also attracted interest from clubs like Newcastle United and Al Hilal SFC.
about.earlyLifeText1: Born in Bhola, Aminul spent most of his childhood in Dhaka, son of Mohammad Imran and Monwara Begum. He is the youngest of three brothers. His brother Moinul Haque, who is ten years older, also played in the Dhaka Premier Division Football League.
about.earlyLifeText2: While in fourth grade, Aminul began training at MSPCC City Club under coach Imtiaz. Playing for City Club's junior team in a local tournament in Mirpur's Alubdi village, Aminul received 150 taka for his performance.
about.earlyLifeText3: In 1993, he participated in the Pioneer Football League with City Club and managed to keep nine consecutive clean sheets in the first phase of the league.
about.politicalIntro: After ending his football career, Aminul Haque entered politics and dedicated himself to public service.
about.bnpRole: Aminul Haque has joined as the Member Secretary of the Dhaka North City Unit of Bangladesh Nationalist Party and is working for the party.
about.politicalStruggleText: During the regime of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from 2009-2024, he was arrested on November 1, 2023 due to two separate sabotage incidents. He was released after several months of imprisonment.
about.politicalConclusion: In his political life, Aminul Haque is as courageous and determined as he was in his football career. He continues to fight for people's rights and democracy.

aminulManifesto.heroSubtitle: For the people, by the people - A roadmap for a prosperous future
aminulManifesto.introText1: Assalamu Alaikum. I am Aminul Haque - Convener of Dhaka Metropolitan North BNP and one of your own. This Dhaka-16 is my home, my neighborhood. Your joys, sorrows, struggles and dreams - I feel them in my heart.
aminulManifesto.introText2: For the past 17 years, we have all been going through difficult times together. Traffic jams, water and gas shortages, extortion, drugs and mismanagement have made our daily lives unbearable. Our children are losing their way, mothers are living in insecurity, families are losing their dreams.
aminulManifesto.introText3: I do politics not for power, but to serve the people. I believe - change is possible if we want it together. And to show you that path of change, I have come to you with my plans and promises.
aminulManifesto.promisesSubtitle: My plans for the development of Dhaka-16
aminulManifesto.commitmentText: This is not an empty promise. This is our collective hope, our collective future. Now the decision is yours - another 17 years of corruption and misrule, or a new era of justice, dignity and hope.
aminulManifesto.commitmentQuote: "I am Aminul Haque, I don't make promises with words, I show them in action."
aminulManifesto.commitmentConclusion: As your child, as your representative, I will be by your side to bring light to every home.

urduCommunity.title: Rights of Urdu-speaking Community

healthcare.content2: Construction of government medical colleges and hospitals
healthcare.content3: Effective measures to prevent dengue and chikungunya

higherEducation.title: Higher Education Development
higherEducation.content1: Converting degree colleges into university colleges

nationalization.title: Nationalization of Educational Institutions

utilities.title: Gas, Water & Electricity
utilities.content1: Ensuring uninterrupted gas, water and electricity supply for every family and necessary renovation and replacement of old, dilapidated gas and water lines

employment.title: Employment Creation
employment.content1: Ensuring employment for the unemployed and youth through technical training, third language education and Job Fairs

sportsAcademy.title: Sports & Sports Academy
sportsAcademy.content1: Creating suitable playgrounds for sports and establishing a full-fledged sports academy

religiousHarmony.title: Religious Harmony
religiousHarmony.content1: Establishing and developing mosques, madrasas, temples, churches and other places of worship in every ward to ensure communal harmony and peaceful celebration of religious festivals regardless of religion, caste, party or opinion

security.title: Security System
security.content1: Installing CCTV, appointing security personnel and ensuring security through local committees in every residential and non-residential area

digital.title: Digital Facilities
digital.content1: Free WiFi Zone in colleges, bus stands and markets, and modern libraries for science-based development among the youth

bnp31Point.heroSubtitle: Roadmap for Restoration of Democracy and State Reform
bnp31Point.introSubtitle: (Formulated for Democratic Reform of Constitution and State System, and Economic Liberation)
bnp31Point.introText1: The people of Bangladesh built this state through the great Liberation War at the cost of a sea of blood, dreaming of democracy, equality, human dignity, and social justice. Today, the ownership of that state is no longer in their hands. The current authoritarian government has shattered the state structure of Bangladesh. This state needs to be repaired and reconstructed. After winning a free, fair, impartial, acceptable and participatory election with the aim of returning the ownership of the country to its people, a "Pro-people National Consensus Government" will be established comprising the political parties participating in the movement to oust the current fascist government.
bnp31Point.introText2: The said "National Government" will undertake the following state transformative reform activities:
bnp31Point.ctaText: Your support and participation is needed to implement these 31 points

p1.title: Formation of Constitution Reform Commission
p1.content: For over a decade, the Awami League government has brought in many irrational fundamental constitutional amendments with the sinister purpose of monopolizing power. A "Constitution Reform Commission" will be formed to review and repeal/amend all controversial and undemocratic constitutional amendments and changes, and other essential constitutional reforms will be made. The referendum system will be reinstated in the constitution to restore people's democratic rights.

p2.title: Establishing a Harmonious Rainbow Nation and Formation of National Reconciliation Commission
p2.content: Instead of politics of revenge and retaliation, an inclusive, discrimination-free and harmonious "Rainbow Nation" will be established on the basis of Bangladeshi nationalism combining all views and paths. A new forward-looking social contract will be reached through continuous dialogue, exchange of views and mutual understanding. A "National Reconciliation Commission" will be formed for this purpose.

p3.title: Reinstatement of Non-partisan Caretaker Government System During Elections
p3.content: A "Non-partisan Caretaker Government during elections" system will be introduced to restore democracy and voting rights in Bangladesh and to give a permanent constitutional and institutional form to a transparent democratic process.

p4.title: Establishing Balance of State Power
p4.content: Balance will be brought to the executive power of the Prime Minister and the Cabinet. The powers, responsibilities and duties of the Executive, Legislative and Judicial branches will be coordinated to establish checks and balances of state power.

p5.title: Determining Term Limit for Prime Minister
p5.content: No one shall serve as Prime Minister for more than two consecutive terms.

p6.title: Introduction of Upper House in Legislature
p6.content: Alongside the existing parliamentary system, an "Upper House of the Legislature" will be introduced comprising distinguished citizens, renowned academics, professionals, political scientists, social scientists and administratively experienced persons for governing the state with expert knowledge.

p7.title: Amendment of Article 70 of the Constitution
p7.content: Amendment of Article 70 of the Constitution will be considered subject to examination to ensure that Members of Parliament can freely express their opinions on all matters except vote of confidence, money bills, constitutional amendment bills and matters involving national security.

p8.title: Reform of Election Commission and Electoral System and Amendment of Related Laws
p8.content: The current "Chief Election Commissioner and Other Election Commissioners Appointment Act, 2022" will be amended to form an effective Election Commission comprising independent, efficient, impartial, acceptable and resolute persons based on the opinions of political parties and distinguished persons.

p9.title: Restructuring of All State, Constitutional and Statutory Institutions for Ensuring Transparency
p9.content: All state, constitutional and statutory institutions will be restructured through legal reform to restore transparency, accountability and credibility, rising above narrow political partisanship.

p10.title: Formation of Judicial Commission, Reinstatement of Supreme Judicial Council and Enactment of Judge Appointment Law
p10.content: Effective independence of the judiciary will be ensured in light of the Constitution of Bangladesh and the verdict of the Masdar Hossain case. A "Judicial Commission" will be formed to reform the current judicial system.

p11.title: Formation of Administrative Reform Commission
p11.content: An "Administrative Reform Commission" will be formed comprising qualified, experienced and wise persons to reform and reorganize the administration with the aim of building patriotic public service and police administration.

p12.title: Formation of Media Commission
p12.content: A "Media Commission" will be formed comprising former Supreme Court judges, media-related professionals and wise, experienced and acceptable media personalities to ensure full freedom of the media and comprehensive reform.

p13.title: Visible and Effective Measures to Prevent Corruption and Appointment of Ombudsman
p13.content: There will be no compromise on corruption. A white paper will be published investigating the money laundering and corruption that occurred over the past one and a half decades, and legal action will be taken against those identified as responsible.

p14.title: Establishing Rule of Law and Human Rights at All Levels
p14.content: Rule of law will be established at all levels. Human values and human dignity will be restored, and disappearances, murders, extrajudicial killings, and inhumane cruel physical and mental torture will be ended.

p15.title: Formation of Economic Reform Commission
p15.content: An "Economic Reform Commission" will be formed comprising expert economists and researchers, experienced bankers, corporate leaders, and administratively experienced persons to ensure economic justice.

p16.title: Ensuring Maximum Religious Freedom
p16.content: Based on the principle "Religion belongs to everyone, the state belongs to all," every religious person will enjoy full rights to practice their own religion.

p17.title: Ensuring Fair Wages Considering Inflation
p17.content: Fair wages (price-index based) for workers will be ensured in light of inflation. Child labor will be stopped and a suitable environment and arrangements for their life development will be ensured.

p18.title: Modernization of Industry, Power, Mineral and Energy Sectors and Establishing Good Governance
p18.content: All draconian laws including the indemnity law in the power, energy and mineral sectors will be repealed and the ongoing unlimited corruption in purchasing electricity from anti-public interest quick rental power plants will be stopped.

p19.title: Development of Foreign Relations Ensuring Priority of National Interest
p19.content: Bangladesh's national interest, national sovereignty and national security will be given highest priority in all areas of foreign relations.

p20.title: Modernizing Defense Forces and Keeping Them Above All Controversy
p20.content: The defense forces will be organized, modernized and inspired with the highest patriotism to protect the country's sovereignty.

p21.title: Making Local Government Institutions Autonomous and Empowered for Decentralization
p21.content: Local government institutions will be made more independent, strong and empowered for extensive decentralization of power.

p22.title: Providing State Honor and Recognition to Martyred Freedom Fighters
p22.content: Arrangements will be made to provide state recognition for everyone's contribution to the 1971 Liberation War. A list of martyrs of the Liberation War will be prepared based on intensive survey on state initiative.

p23.title: Formulating Modern and Contemporary Youth Development Policy
p23.content: Modern and contemporary youth development policy will be formulated incorporating the vision, thoughts and aspirations of the youth.

p24.title: Taking Appropriate Steps for Women's Dignity, Protection and Empowerment
p24.content: Specific programs will be undertaken for women's empowerment to ensure effective participation of women in the national development process.

p25.title: Building an Educated Population Capable of Meeting Future Challenges Through Demand and Knowledge-based Education
p25.content: Need-based education at primary and secondary levels and knowledge-based education at higher education will be prioritized, eliminating the current anarchy in education.

p26.title: Implementing the Policy of "Health for All"
p26.content: Universal health coverage will be introduced based on the principle of "Health for All" and "No death without treatment," modeled after the UK's "NHS," considering health as an asset.

p27.title: Ensuring Fair Prices for Agricultural Products Including Production and Marketing Protection for Farmers
p27.content: Fair prices for agricultural products will be ensured. Government procurement centers for agricultural products will be gradually established in all unions.

p28.title: Modernization of Road, Rail, Waterways and Establishing Multi-dimensional Transportation System
p28.content: An integrated multi-dimensional transportation system will be built across the country by necessary reform of roads, railways and waterways for development of the country's communication infrastructure.

p29.title: Effective Steps to Address Climate Change Crisis and Natural Disasters, and River Management and Canal Excavation Initiatives
p29.content: Sustainable and effective strategies will be adopted to address the climate change crisis and damage.

p30.title: Development and Optimal Use of ICT, Space Research and Nuclear Energy
p30.content: Necessary steps will be taken to elevate the ICT sector to global standards and its application will be prioritized in all areas.

p31.title: Formulation and Implementation of Contemporary, Planned, Environment-friendly Housing and Urbanization Policies
p31.content: Through formulation of a national master plan, planned housing and urbanization policies will be adopted and implemented without destroying agricultural land in urban and rural areas and reducing the ever-increasing population pressure in cities.

bnp19Point.heroDesc: Formulated for the socio-economic liberation of the country
bnp19Point.introText: Shaheed President Ziaur Rahman formulated the 19-point program for the socio-economic liberation of Bangladesh. This program provides direction for the nation's development and prosperity, and its relevance remains intact even today.
bnp19Point.ctaText: We are committed to achieving the development and prosperity of Bangladesh following the path shown by Shaheed President Ziaur Rahman

p1.title: Protect the country's independence, integrity and sovereignty
p1.content: Protect the country's independence, integrity and sovereignty in all respects.

p2.title: Full reflection of the four principles of the constitution in national life
p2.content: Full reflection of the four principles of the constitution in national life: absolute trust and faith in Almighty Allah, democracy, nationalism, and social and economic justice through socialism.

p3.title: Build ourselves as a self-reliant nation by all means
p3.content: Build ourselves as a self-reliant nation by all means.

p4.title: Ensure public participation at all levels of administration
p4.content: Ensure public participation at all levels of administration, development activities and law and order maintenance.

p5.title: Strengthen rural and national economy through agricultural development
p5.content: Strengthen rural and national economy through agricultural development on the basis of highest priority.

p6.title: Make the country self-sufficient in food
p6.content: Make the country self-sufficient in food and ensure that no one goes hungry.

p7.title: Ensure at least basic clothing for everyone
p7.content: Ensure at least basic clothing for everyone by increasing cloth production in the country.

p8.title: Provide housing as much as possible
p8.content: Provide housing as much as possible so that no citizen remains homeless.

p9.title: Free the country from the curse of illiteracy
p9.content: Free the country from the curse of illiteracy.

p10.title: Provide minimum healthcare for all citizens
p10.content: Provide minimum healthcare for all citizens.

p11.title: Establish proper dignity of women and organize the youth
p11.content: Establish proper dignity of women in society and organize the youth to inspire them in nation building.

p12.title: Provide necessary encouragement to the private sector
p12.content: Provide necessary encouragement to the private sector for economic development of the country.

p13.title: Improve workers' conditions and build healthy worker-owner relations
p13.content: Improve workers' conditions and build healthy worker-owner relations in the interest of increased production.

p14.title: Encourage public service mentality among government employees
p14.content: Encourage public service and nation-building mentality among government employees and improve their financial condition.

p16.title: Build friendship with all foreign countries on equal terms
p16.content: Build friendship with all foreign countries on equal terms and strengthen relations with Muslim countries.

p17.title: Decentralize administration and strengthen local government
p17.content: Decentralize administration and development system and strengthen local government.

p18.title: Establish a corruption-free, justice-based social system
p18.content: Establish a corruption-free, justice-based social system.

p19.title: Fully protect rights of all citizens and strengthen national unity
p19.content: Fully protect the rights of all citizens regardless of religion, tribe and caste, and strengthen national unity and solidarity.
